label: ham
subject: Rev 516: new logo, fixed links in http://samba.org/~tridge/ctdb
body: 61 (return) [ To avoid the vague expressions of followers, &c., I use, after Villehardouin, the word _sergeants_ for all horsemen who were not knights. There were sergeants at arms, and sergeants at law; and if we visit the parade and Westminster Hall, we may observe the strange result of the distinction, (Ducange, Glossar. Latin, _Servientes_, &c., tom. vi. p. 226—231.)]
